alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Delaware; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 8:55PM CDT until April 04 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Buchanan County in northeastern Iowa... Northeastern Benton County in east central Iowa... Southwestern Delaware County in northeastern Iowa... Northwestern Linn County in east central Iowa... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 854 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hoefle-Dulin Park, or over Vinton, moving northeast at 40 mph. At 852 PM CDT, Benton county emergency management reported hail the size of quarters two miles south of Vinton. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Wildcat Bluff Park around 900 PM CDT. Center Point, Urbana and Cheney around 905 PM CDT. Spencers Grove around 910 PM CDT. Walker and Rowley around 915 PM CDT. Troy Mills around 920 PM CDT. Quasqueton around 925 PM CDT. Winthrop, Monti and Robinson around 930 PM CDT. Winthrop Golf Course around 935 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lime Creek County Park, Winthrop Golf Course, Robinson, Vinton Memorial Airport, Rodgers Park, Delaware County Fairgrounds, Manchester Airport, Benton City Park, Hoefle-Dulin Park and Monti. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Iowa.
